questions.question: The exploration of multiple paths in a non-deterministic Turing machine (NDTM) is significant because it:

answers.a: Guarantees a solution to NP problems
answers.b: Demonstrates a (theoretical) way to solve problems that may not be efficiently solvable by deterministic machines
answers.c: Makes NDTMs faster than deterministic machines
answers.d: Allows NDTMs to solve problems outside of NP

questions.question: A deterministic Turing machine is characterized by:

answers.b: Making random decisions at each step
answers.c: Following a single, defined computational path for a given input
answers.d: Solving problems that non-deterministic machines cannot

questions.question: Which statement is true about regular languages?

answers.a: They can only be recognized by non-deterministic machines
answers.b: They are more complex than context-free languages
answers.c: They are recognized by both deterministic and non-deterministic finite automata
answers.d: They require Turing machines (or higher) for recognition

questions.question: What does it mean for a problem to be NP-hard?

answers.a: It can be solved in polynomial time
answers.b: Its solution can be verified in polynomial time
answers.c: It is at least as hard as the hardest problems in NP
answers.d: It is solvable by non-deterministic machines only

questions.question: In computational theory, 'NP' refers to problems where:

answers.a: Solutions can be found in non-polynomial time
answers.b: Solutions can be verified in polynomial time by a DTM
answers.c: Deterministic machines can find solutions faster than non-deterministic machines
answers.d: Solutions are always available but hard to compute
